content.description: Under the main roof to the right side, find the massive "blast hole" pocket jug. Follow the roof directly to the base and locate the two staggered flat rails. Sit start matched in the rails (side-pull one of them" and reach far and right to the huge jug rail. Follow the rail and jugs left to top out to the left of the apex tip through the notch.

Sit start at the base of the boulder below the huge "blast hole" pocket/jug. At the base, start with a right on one of the two staggered flat rails, and a left on a distant sidepull. 

  Reach back overhead with a right to the iron rib crimp, and match below that on another crimp. Dyno way out to the deep pocket/blast hole. Continue to the top as per "Mag Right".

On the left side of the roof, follow the low edge of the roof right to the long, smooth, flat sloper lip. Start matched on the blank sloper lip below the thin in-cut crimp. Dangle from the sloper, and campus right up to the thin crimp, and then to the top. Roll over for the top out.

To the far right side of the face with the big roof. Find the low diagonal crack/jug at the base and sit start there. Climb direct past several jugs of your choice to top out to the left side of the point through the notch. 

Admin Note: There is actually nothing greasy about these pieces.
Stand start matched in the flat undercling under the left side of the base of the roof above the close block. Climb out of the roof through good holds to the top out.

Under the left side of the roof in the very back, find the loose looking, but very solid, wedged jug block. Start matched on the block and make an enormous span to the left to a pinch in the roof. Continue left with a cross to the flat undercling, and climb out to top out at the left of the roof past jugs to a flat top out.
A fun, low roof located near the Swede tunnel. Several great climbs and good landings.
